chapter.title: Easy streaming
chapter.para: The easier way to start streaming with VLC is by using one of the graphical user interfaces: wxwindows for Windows and GNU/Linux, the skinnable Windows and GNU/Linux interface or the MacOS X native interface.

The Streaming/Transcoding Wizard leads you step by step through the process of streaming your media on a network or saving it to your hard drive. This Wizard offers easy to use menus but provides a restricted set of options.

note.para: The wizard is only available for the wxWindows interface.

chapter.para: To launch the Streaming/Transcoding Wizard, open the "File" menu, and select the Wizard menu item.
First select the general action you want to acheive.

listitem.para: Stream to network: Choose this option if you want to stream media on network.
Transcode/Save to file: Choose this option if you want to change a file's audi codec and/or video codec and/or encapsulation method.

chapter.para: Select any stream (such as a file, a UDP network stream, a disc ...) by using the "Open File" dialog or an item in your playlist.

Partial Extract: To read only part of the stream, check the "Enable" checkbox and choose a start and end date (in seconds). This option should only be used with streams you can control such as files or discs but not UDP network streams.
If you choosed to Stream to network you can now specify the streaming method. Available methods are:

listitem.para: UDP Unicast: Stream to a single computer. Enter the computer's IP address (in the 0.0.0.0 - 223.255.255.255 range).
UDP Multicast: Stream to multiple computers by multicast. Enter the multicast IP address (in the 224.0.0.0 239.255.255.255 range).

HTTP: Stream by using the HTTP protocol. If you leave the "Destination" text box empty, VLC will listen on all your IP addresses on port 8080. Specify the address and port on which to listen using the following syntax ip[:port].

chapter.para: If you choosed Transcode/Save to file you can now specify the new audio and video codecs and bitrates.

Choose the encapsulation format. The UDP streaming methods require MPEG TS encapsulation. The HTTP streaming method requires MPEG PS, MPEG TS, MPEG 1, OGG, RAW or ASF encapsulation. Saving to a file can use any encapsulation format.
If you choosed to Stream to network you can now specify several options.

listitem.para: Time To Live (TTL) This sets the numbers of routers your stream can go through. If you do not know what this means, you should leave the default value of "1". For more information, contact your network administrator.
SAP Announce To advertise your stream when using the UDP streaming method, enter an SAP announce and check the checkbox. This is NOT available for the HTTP streaming method.

chapter.para: If you choosed Transcode/Save to file you can now specify the destination file you want to save to.
